it.polito.computervision.virtualscreen.impl

Class FlatVirtualScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polito.computervision.virtualscreen.AbstractVirtualScreen
      • it.polito.computervision.virtualscreen.impl.FlatVirtualScreen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VirtualScreen

    public class FlatVirtualScreen
extends AbstractVirtualScreen
    A simple flat VirtualScreen. A Point3D is touching if its z coordinate is <= depth. The 2D projection is simply the input point with z = 0.
    Author:
    giovanni

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class it.polito.computervision.virtualscreen.AbstractVirtualScreen

    • Method Detail

      • isTouching

        public boolean isTouching(com.primesense.nite.Point3D<java.lang.Float> point)
        Checks if the given 3D point is touching the 2D virtual screen
        Parameters:
        point - The 3D point to check
        Returns:
        true if it is touching the virtual screen, false otherwise.

      • get2DProjection

        public org.openni.Point2D<java.lang.Float> get2DProjection(com.primesense.nite.Point3D<java.lang.Float> point)
        Converts the 3D point into its 2D projection on the virtual screen. Notice that Point3D comes from com.primesense.nite package, whereas Point2D comes from org.openni package. The reason is that Point2D's constructor is not visible.
        Parameters:
        point - The 3D point to convert
        Returns:
        the 2D projection of the point on the virtual screen
